qas.question: What was the first antibiotic developed from nature?
What also happened in 1939 besides tyrothricin?
What was tyrothricin used for during the war?
What was the first antibiotic developed from wounds?
What was tyrothricin used for during toxicity?

plausible_answers.text: the Axis and the Allied powers

qas.question: Rene Dubos was not shared between who?

context: In <a1_0><b6_0>1939<b6_0/><a1_0/>, coinciding with the <a2_0>start of World War II,<a2_0/> <a3_0><b7_0>Rene Dubos<b7_0/><a3_0/> reported the discovery of the first naturally derived antibiotic, <a0_0><b5_0>tyrothricin<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a compound of 20% gramicidin and 80% tyrocidine, from B. brevis. It was one of the first commercially manufactured antibiotics universally and was very effective in treating <a4_0><b8_0>wounds and ulcers<b8_0/><a4_0/> during World War II. Gramicidin, however, could not be used systemically because of toxicity. Tyrocidine also proved too toxic for systemic usage. Research results obtained during that period were not shared between <b9_0>the Axis and the Allied powers<b9_0/> during the war.
